column2: A long time ago, in a galaxy far, far away...^^Welcome, to Star Wars: Conquest, a mod for Mount&Blade. Before you can start playing the game you must create a character. Please choose your race:

It is a period of civil war... The Galactic Empire is in constant battle with the Rebel Alliance while the Hutt Cartel looks for opportunities to make money and expand their area of rule.  Whatever course you take a great adventure awaits you.
Attack on the Yavin IV Shrine
You approach a field where the locals are training with weapons. You can practice here to improve your combat skills.
Tutorial #1: Basic movement and weapon selection. {s1}
Tutorial #5: Commanding a band of soldiers. {s5}
Character Renown: {reg5}^Honor Rating: {reg6}^Party Morale: {reg8}^Party Size Limit: {reg7}^
The battle is over. {s1} Your side killed {reg5} enemies and lost {reg6} troops over the battle. You personally slew {reg7} adversaries in the fighting.
You spent your early years traveling around the galaxy with your parents. Your father was...
As you grew older you decided to...
This menu automatically returns to caller.
Increase last offensive time by 24 hours.
It's {s1} on day {reg0} of your adventure.^^{s9}^^What do you want to do?
What area of the ship do you want to walk around?
Recruit a new commander. Your faction currently has {reg1} leaders.
Choose a culture:^^^The culture of your Faction determine the guards in your territories, the type of recruits from your planets, and the soldiers in your commanders armies.
Choose ability and then press a key to assign/change its key binding. To unassign key choose ability and press ESC

Modding/Cheat Menu (for development use):^^This menu is intended for development use while we are working on improving this mod. Please do not report any bugs with this functionality since it is for testing only.
Go to the SWC Dev Island.
Relocate player to a random planet.
Add mercenary units to player party.
Raise player's attributes, skills, and proficiencies.
Add credits and equipment to player.

Modding/Cheat Menu (for development use):^^This menu is intended for development use while we are working on improving this mod. Please do not report any bugs with this functionality since it is for testing only.
Relocate a Force-Sensitive Trainer to the closest planet.
Relocate a Clone Wars Era merchant to the closest planet.
Relocate a Droid Parts merchant to the closest planet.
Relocate a Plastic Surgeon to the closest planet.
Relocate a random NPC to the closest planet.
Recruit some of your prisoners to your party.

Export/Import NPCs^^Instructions:^^1) click on their name^2) press the 'C' key^3) click Statistics^4) Choose to Export/Import^5) click 'Done' when you are finished^^Current selection:  {reg0?{s0}:none}

Export/Import NPCs^^Instructions:^^1) click on their name^2) press the 'C' key^3) click Statistics^4) Choose to Export/Import^5) click 'Done' when you are finished^^Current selection:  {reg0?{s0}:none}
You offer your prisoners freedom if they agree to join you as soldiers. {s18}
You have no prisoners to recruit from.
Please choose your race:^^Note: You should review your character in the face generator after making this change.
You are at day {reg0}. Your current luck is {reg1}. Are you sure you want to retire?
The decision is made, and you resolve to give up your adventurer's life and settle down. You sell off your weapons and armour, gather up all your credits, and depart into the sunset....
May the Force be with you.
Pay cash first and the rest from bank account
Pay from bank account first and the rest in cash
Don't pay anything. Your troops will lose morale
Bring the herd to a stop.
How many animals do you want to slaughter?
You and your opponent prepare to fight for honour.
{s2} You have {reg10} troops fit for battle against their {reg11}.
Order your troops to attack without you.
Pull back, leaving some soldiers behind to cover your retreat.
Please reselect a companion as the commander for the comming battle.^^Current:{s7}.

As the party member with the highest tactics skill, ({reg2}), {reg3?you devise:{s3} devises} a plan that will allow you and your troops to escape with your lives, but you'll have to leave {reg4} soldiers behind to stop the enemy from following you.
Go on. The sacrifice of these troops will save the rest.
No. We leave no one behind.
You tell {reg4} of your troops to hold the enemy while you retreat with the rest of your party.
Your troops prepare to attack the enemy.
Order your soldiers to continue the attack.
You come across a battle between {s2} and {s1}. You decide to...
Rush to the aid of the {s1}.
You are helping the {s2} against the {s1}. You have {reg10} troops fit for battle against the enemy's {reg11}.
Order your troops to attack with your allies while you stay back.
Pass through the siege lines and enter {s1}.
The besiegers let you approach the entrance without challenge.
{s1} remains under siege. The banners of {s2} fly above the camp of the besiegers, where you and your troops are welcomed.
Request a meeting with the commander.
Order your soldiers to join the next assault without you.
Approach the planet and contact the guards.
Disguise yourself and try to sneak onto the planet.
You approach the landing bay. The guards on the observation posts watch you closely.
After a brief wait, the guards lower the shields for you and allow your party to land.
The lord of this planet has forbidden you from landing on the surface, and the guard sergeant informs you that his troops will fire if you attempt to come any closer.
With whom do you want to meet?
Your request for a meeting is relayed inside, and finally they appear to speak with you.
Call for a meeting with the commander.
Lead your soldiers in an assault.
Order your soldiers to attack while you stay back...
The defenders sally out to meet your assault.
As the party member with the highest Engineer skill ({reg2}), {reg3?you estimate:{s3} estimates} that it will take {reg4} hours to destroy the shields so the assault can begin.
As the party member with the highest Engineer skill ({reg2}), {reg3?you estimate:{s3} estimates} that building a siege tower will take {reg4} hours.
{s3} has fallen to your troops, and you now have full control of the {reg2?planet:station}.{reg1? It would seem that there is nothing stopping you from taking it for yourself...:}
{s3} has fallen to your troops, and you now have full control of the station. It is time to send word to {s9} about your victory. {s5}
Request that {s3} be awarded to you.

You receive a message from your liege, {s3}.^^ {reg4?She:He} has decided to grant {s2}{reg3? and the nearby planet of {s4}:} to you, with all due incomes and titles, to hold in {reg4?her:his} name for as long as you maintain your oath of homage.

You receive a message from your leader, {s3}.^^ 'I was most pleased to hear of your valiant efforts in the capture of {s2}. Your victory has gladdened all our hearts. You also requested me to give you ownership of the planet, but that is a favour which I fear I cannot grant, as you already hold significant estates in my faction. Instead I have sent you {reg6} credits to cover the expenses of your campaign, but {s2} I give to {s5}.'
You have been wronged! Renounce you oath to your liege!
Renouncing your oath is a grave act. Your lord may condemn you and confiscate your lands and holdings. However, if you return them of your own free will, he may let the betrayal go without a fight.
Renounce your oath and give up your holdings.
Renounce your oath and hold on to your lands, including {s2}.
Remain loyal and accept the decision.
Your lord offers to extend your territories! {s1} sends word that he is willing to grant {s2} to you in payment for your loyal service, adding it to your holdings. What is your answer?
Reject. You have no interest in holding {s2}.

With a brief ceremony, you are officially confirmed as the new lord of {s2}{reg3? and its bound planet {s4}:}. {reg3?They:It} will make a fine part of your fiefdom. You can now claim the rents and revenues from your personal estates there, draft soldiers from the populace, and manage the lands as you see fit. However, you are also expected to defend your fief and your people from harm, as well as maintaining the rule of law and order.
You had a contract with {s1} to serve him for a certain duration. Your contract has now expired. What will you do?
Renew your contract with {s1} for another month.
{s1} is launching an assault against the walls of {s2}. You have {reg10} troops fit for battle against the enemy's {reg11}. You decide to...
Order your men to join the battle without you.
As you approach, you are spotted by the planet guards, who welcome you and lower the shields for their {lord/lady}.
What action do you have in mind?
Force the colonists to give you supplies.
Loot and burn this minor planet.

A heavy blow from the fugitive sends you to the ground, and your vision spins and goes dark. Time passes. When you open your eyes again you find yourself battered and bloody, but luckily none of the wounds appear to be lethal.

In a battle worthy of song, you and your men drive the bandits out of the village, making it safe once more. The villagers have little left in the way of wealth after their ordeal, but they offer you all they can find.
Take it as your just due.
Refuse, stating that they need these items more than you do.
{s19}^{reg6?^^You are currently building {s7}. The building will be completed after {reg8} day{reg9?s:}.:}
{s19} As the party member with the highest engineer skill ({reg2}), {reg3?you reckon:{s3} reckons} that building the {s4} will cost you {reg5} credits and will take {reg6} days.
I don't have enough money for that.

The bandits fall before you as wheat to a scythe! Soon you stand alone in the streets while most of your attackers lie unconscious, dead or dying. Searching the bodies, you find a purse which must have belonged to a previous victim of these brutes. Or perhaps, it was given to them by someone who wanted to arrange a suitable ending to your life.
As the party member with the highest looting skill ({reg2}), {reg3?you reckon:{s1} reckons} that you can steal as many as {reg4} nerfs from the village's herd.
It will be difficult to force and threaten the colonists into giving their precious supplies. You think you will need at least one hour.
The villagers grudgingly bring out what they have for you.
Some of the angry villagers grab their tools and prepare to resist you. It looks like you'll have a fight on your hands if you continue.
The villagers here are few and frightened, and they quickly scatter and run before you. The planet is at your mercy.
Plunder the planet, then raze it.

On your orders your troops sack the village, pillaging everything of any value, and then put the buildings to the torch. From the coins and valuables that are found, you get your share of {reg1} credits.
Fighting with courage and determination, the villagers manage to hold together and drive off your forces.
Do you wish to continue looting this village?
You receive the accumulated rents and taxes of all your planets, amounting to {reg1} credits.
Take a walk around the site.
Dock your ship in the hangar bay{s1}.
You have been eliminated from the tournament.
You have won the tournament of {s3}! You are filled with pride as the crowd cheers your name. In addition to honour, fame and glory, you earn a prize of {reg9} credits. {s8}
As the only {reg3?fighter:man} to remain undefeated this day, {s1} wins the lists and the glory of this tournament.
{s1}You are at tier {reg0} of the tournament, with {reg1} participants remaining. In the next round, there will be {reg2} teams with {reg3} {reg4?fighters:fighter} each.
Are you sure you want to withdraw from the tournament?
Yes. This is a pointless affectation.
No, not as long as there is a chance of victory!
The odds against you are {reg5} to {reg6}.{reg1? You have already bet {reg1} credits on yourself, and if you win, you will earn {reg2} credits.:} How much do you want to bet?
If you bet {reg1} credits, you will earn {reg2} credits if you win the tournament. Is that all right?
You ask one of the criers for the names of the tournament participants. They are:^{s11}
As the party member with the highest trade skill ({reg2}), {reg3?you expect:{s1} expects} that collecting taxes from here will take {reg4} days...
You've collected {reg3} credits in taxes from {s3}. {s19} will be expecting you to take the money to him.
Your quick action and strong arm have successfully put down the revolt. Surely, anyone with a mind to rebel against you will think better of it after this.
You could collect only {reg3} credits as tax from {s3} before the revolt broke out. {s1} won't be happy, but some silver will placate him better than nothing at all...
The people of {s3} are outraged at your demands and decry it as nothing more than extortion. They're getting very restless, and they may react badly if you keep pressing them.
Agree to reduce your collection by half. ({s1} may be upset)

You are interrupted while collecting the taxes at {s3}. A large band of angry {reg9?colonists:citizens} is marching nearer, shouting about the exorbitant taxes and waving torches and weapons. It looks like they aim to fight you!
As the party member with the highest training skill ({reg2}), {reg3?you expect:{s1} expects} that getting some colonists ready for practice will take {reg4} hours.
You put the colonists through the basics of soldiering, discipline and obedience. You think {reg0} of them {reg1?have:has} fully grasped the training and {reg1?are:is} ready for some practice.

As you get ready to continue the training, a sentry from the planet runs up to you, shouting alarums. The bandits have been spotted on the horizon, riding hard for {s3}. The administrator begs that you organize your newly-trained militia and face them.

The bandits are broken! Those few who remain run off with their tails between their legs, terrified of the colonists and their new champion. The villagers have little left in the way of wealth after their ordeal, but they offer you all they can find to show their gratitude.
Take it as your just due.
Refuse, stating that they need these items more than you do.
Town Name: {s1}^Rent Income: {reg1} credits^Tariff Income: {reg2} credits^Food Stock: for {reg3} days
You overhear several discussions about the price of trade goods across the local area. You listen closely, trying to work out the best deals around.
As the party member with the highest trade skill ({reg2}), {reg3?you try to figure out:{s1} tries to figure out} the best goods to trade in. {s2}
Disguised in the garments of a citizen, you fool the guards and make your way onto the planet.
As you try to sneak in, one of the guards recognizes you and raises the alarm! You must flee back to your ship before all the guards come down on you!
Try to fight your way out!
You drive off the guards and cover your trail before running off, easily losing your pursuers in the maze of streets.
You make your way back to your ship and quickly retreat to the safety of the stars.
{s2} offers you a sum of {reg12} credits if you are willing to sell him {s1}.
You approach a training field where you can practice your martial skills. What kind of training do you want to do?
How many opponents will you go against?
What kind of weapon do you want to train with?
What kind of ranged weapon do you want to train with?
What range do you want to practice at?
{s15} will soon select a new marshall for {s23}. Some of the lords have suggested your name as a likely candidate.
Let {s15} learn that you are willing to serve as marshall.
Tell everyone that you are too busy these days.

Suddenly all the world goes black around you. Many hours later you regain your conciousness and find yourself at the spot you fell. Your enemies must have taken you up for dead and left you there. However, it seems that none of your wound were lethal, and altough you feel awful, you find out that can still walk. You get up and try to look for any other survivors from your party.
After painful days of being dragged about as a prisoner, you find a chance and escape from your captors!
You are quickly surrounded by guards who take away your weapons. With curses and insults, they throw you into the dungeon where you must while away the miserable days of your captivity.
You remain in disguise for as long as possible before revealing yourself. The guards are outraged and beat you savagely before throwing you back into the cell for God knows how long...
After days of imprisonment, you are finally set free when your captors exchange you with another prisoner.

You spend long hours in the sunless dank of the dungeon, more than you can count. Suddenly one of your captors enters your cell with an offer; he proposes to free you in return for {reg5} credits of your hidden wealth. You decide to...
Refuse him, wait for something better.
More days pass in the darkness of your cell. You get through them as best you can, enduring the kicks and curses of the guards, watching your underfed body waste away more and more...

{s8} sends word that he wishes you to join his new military campaign. You need to bring at least {reg13} troops to the army, and are instructed to raise more men with all due haste if you do not have enough.
{s8} sends word that he wishes to speak with you about a task he needs performed. He requests you to come and see him as soon as possible.
{s8} sends word that you are to join the siege of {s9} in preparation for a full assault. Your troops are to take {s9} at all costs.
You have disobeyed orders and failed to follow {s8}. In anger he has disbanded you from the army, and sends a stern warning that your actions will not be forgotten.

You receive an offer of promotion!^^ {s8} of {s9} has sent you a message with great news. You would be granted the honour of becoming a commander {lord/lady} of {s9}, and in return {s8} asks you to swear an oath of homage to him and fight in the war, although he offers you no colonies or titles. He will surely be offended if you do not take the offer...

You receive an offer of promotion!^^ {s8} of {s9} has sent you a message with great news. You would be granted the honour of becoming a commander {lord/lady} of {s9}, and in return {s8} asks you to swear an oath of homage to him and fight in the war, offering you the planet of {s2} for your loyal service. He will surely be offended if you do not take the offer...
In order to become a commander, you must swear an oath of homage to {s3}. You shall have to find him and give him your oath in person. {s5}
You Receive a Peace Offer^^{s1} offers you a peace agreement. What is your answer?

You now posess land in your name without being tied to any faction, as a masterless warlord who knows no higher authority. Enjoy this freedom, but know that the kings of the land will not look to you kindly and will make every attempt to dispose of you. You may find life very difficult without the protection of a faction.
You no longer hold any land.
Enemies have Laid Waste to a territory.^^{s1} has been raided by {s2} of {s3}!
Your planet is under Attack!^^{s2} of {s3} is laying waste to {s1}.
Calradia Conquered by One Faction^^{s1} has defeated all rivals and stands as the sole faction.
Your Old Faction was Defeated^^You won the battle against {s1}! This ends your struggle which started after you renounced your oath to them.
An Estate was Lost^^You have lost {s1} to {s2}.
Good news!^^ {s1} has left {s2} and joined {s3}.
Declaration of War^^{s1} has declared war against {s2}!
Peace Agreement^^{s1} and {s2} have made peace!
Rebellion Success^^ Your rebellion is victorious! Your faction now has the sole claim to the title of {s11}, with {s12} as the single ruler.
You spot your victim and follow him, observing as he turns a corner into a dark alley. This will surely be your best opportunity to attack him.
Please choose the location for this battle.^{s1}
Please choose the type of battle.^You have chosen: {s1}
Please choose the faction for army {reg1}.^Your choice: {s1}
Please choose the main class of your character. (This determines your choice of subclasses)
Please choose the sub class of your character. (This determines your skills and equipment)
Select the troops for army {reg11} (Left CTRL + Left Click removes troops, Left Shift + Left Click adds five troops and Left Shift + Left Control + Left Click removes five troops.)
The factions for this battle are:{s1},{s2},{s3},{s4},{s5}.
The number of troops for this team are:{reg1},{reg2},{reg3},{reg4},{reg5},{reg6},{reg7},{reg8},{reg9},{reg10}
From here the time of day and the weather can be changed.
Battle is over. {s1} Your party killed {reg5} troops, enemy party killed {reg6} troops. You have killed {reg7} troops.
Let your heroes select gear from the item pool.
Insufficient item pool space for auto-upgrade.

Your heroes will automatically grab items from the item pool based on their pre-selected upgrade options. Heroes listed first in the party order will have first pick. Any equipment no longer needed will be placed back into the item pool. Are you sure you wish to do this?
You arrive at {s1}. There are a number of ^facilities here. Which one do you want to visit?

You visit the bank. ^^You can deposit money and earn interest, or take a loan. ^^You currently have {reg6} credits deposited with this bank.{s3} {s2} ^^The current interest rate is {reg10}% for deposits and {reg9}% for loans.
Withdraw all funds from your account.

The loan officer at the bank has approved you for a loan.^^You can only take out one loan at a time. The interest will be set at the time you take the loan and the amount will be added to your total debt.^^All loans run for 30 days. You will need to repay your loan before that time runs out.
Take a loan of 1000 credits. You'll have to repay {reg11} credits.
Take a loan of 2500 credits. You'll have to repay {reg11} credits.
Take a loan of 5000 credits. You'll have to repay {reg11} credits.

Star Wars: Conquest - FAQ & Notes^^This mod is still in development. We hope to eventually add more models, factions, quests, complete scene editing for all scenes, and add other functionality. Please post any bugs or suggestions on our forum.^^Content for this mod and future changes will primarily be focused on the original movies, Episode 4-6 range.  Clone Wars era troops and equipment have been included but are not planned to be further improved or a major feature of this mod.^^Scene editing is still in progress and we have made changes to many of the major planets like Tatooine, Yavin IV, Naboo, Geonosis, Ryloth, Kashyyyk, and Endor.  We are also working on creating several generic scenes to use for battlestations, outposts, and smaller planets. This is still a work in progress so not all scenes have been modified yet.^^The Trade Federation Base has several merchants like a Force-Sensitive Trainer, Clone Wars Era Merchant, Droid Parts Merchant, Plastic Surgeon, and others. Their inventory refreshes every hour and they can also randomly appear in the cantina's.^^Clone Troopers, B1-Series Battledroids, Baby Rancors, and Force-Sensitive troops can be recruited by building village upgrades.^^Space Battles can be found at the Training Academy.  Improving the controls or this functionality is a lower priority but may be reviewed in the future.^^Heavy Weapons (rocket launcher, flame rifle, etc) and some force powers (force kill, force knockdown, etc) are include for fun but are overpowered and will unbalance the game if you choose to use them.^^Currently some spaceships can be purchased and upgraded at the Trade Federation base and we plan to add more later.^^It is possible to get droids from Jawa prisoners but currently these droids do not do anything in battle.^^We could use help with this mod with models, textures, scene editing, and coding. Please post on our forum if you are interested in helping.^^Thanks very much to everybody who has directly or indirectly contributed to this mod, we all appreciate it.
